About

Hello! I’m a PhD student in machine learning at Oxford, supervised by Yee Whye Teh and Arnaud Doucet and funded by Google DeepMind.

My research interests are mainly in representation learning and generative models. Previously, I’ve worked on disentanglement and semantic inpainting and its applications to various scientific problems.

I also enjoy making visualizations of algorithms and concepts in maths.

Before starting my PhD, I worked as a machine learning scientist at STIC. I also studied computational maths at Stanford University and theoretical physics at Imperial College.
